me.Abhigya.core.util.scheduler

Class SchedulerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.Abhigya.core.util.scheduler.SchedulerUtils

  • public class SchedulerUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Useful class for dealing with schedulers. This is just a direct-access to the scheduler of Bukkit.

    See Also:
    Bukkit.getScheduler()

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleSyncDelayedTask

        public static int scheduleSyncDelayedTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                          long delay,
                                          org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Schedules a once off task to occur after a delay.

        This task will be executed by the main server thread.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        delay - Delay in server ticks before executing task
        plugin - Plugin that owns the task
        Returns:
        Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

      • scheduleSyncDelayedTask

        public static int scheduleSyncDelayedTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                          org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Schedules a once off task to occur as soon as possible.

        This task will be executed by the main server thread.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        plugin - Plugin that owns the task
        Returns:
        Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

      • scheduleSyncRepeatingTask

        public static int scheduleSyncRepeatingTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                            long delay,
                                            long period,
                                            org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Schedules a repeating task.

        This task will be executed by the main server thread.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        delay - Delay in server ticks before executing first repeat
        period - Period in server ticks of the task
        plugin - Plugin that owns the task
        Returns:
        Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

      • callSyncMethod

        public static <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> callSyncMethod(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task,
                                                                org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Calls a method on the main thread and returns a Future object. This task will be executed by the main server thread.
        • Note: The Future.get() methods must NOT be called from the main thread.
        • Note2: There is at least an average of 10ms latency until the isDone() method returns true.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The callable's return type
        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed
        plugin - Plugin that owns the task
        Returns:
        Future Future object related to the task

      • cancelTask

        public static void cancelTask(int id)
        Removes task from scheduler.

        Parameters:
        id - Id number of task to be removed

      • cancelTasks

        public static void cancelTasks(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Removes all tasks associated with a particular plugin from the scheduler.

        Parameters:
        plugin - Owner of tasks to be removed

      • isCurrentlyRunning

        public static boolean isCurrentlyRunning(int id)
        Check if the task is currently running.

        A repeating task might not be running currently, but will be running in the future. A task that has finished, and does not repeat, will not be running ever again.

        Explicitly, a task is running if there exists a thread for it, and that thread is alive.

        Parameters:
        id - The task to check.
        Returns:
        If the task is currently running.

      • isQueued

        public static boolean isQueued(int id)
        Check if the task queued to be run later.

        If a repeating task is currently running, it might not be queued now but could be in the future. A task that is not queued, and not running, will not be queued again.

        Parameters:
        id - The task to check.
        Returns:
        If the task is queued to be run.

      • getActiveWorkers

        public static java.util.List<org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitWorker> getActiveWorkers()
        Returns a list of all active workers.

        This list contains async tasks that are being executed by separate threads.

        Returns:
        Active workers

      • getPendingTasks

        public static java.util.List<org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask> getPendingTasks()
        Returns a list of all pending tasks. The ordering of the tasks is not related to their order of execution.

        Returns:
        Active workers

      • runTaskAsynchronously

        public static org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTaskAsynchronously(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                                                    org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
                                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks.

        Returns a task that will run asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be run
        plugin - Reference to the plugin scheduling task
        Returns:
        BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

      • runTaskTimer

        public static org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask runTaskTimer(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                                           long delay,
                                                           long period,
                                                           org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a task that will repeatedly run until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

        Parameters:
        task - Task to be run
        delay - Ticks to wait before running the task
        period - Ticks to wait between runs
        plugin - Reference to the plugin scheduling task
        Returns:
        BukkitTask that contains the id number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
